edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models
Class ObservableList<T>

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models.ObservableList<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<T>, java.util.Collection<T>, java.util.List<T>
public class ObservableList<T>
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.util.List<T>

An ObservableList is a collection which maintains an ordering for its elements. Every element in the ObservableList has an index. Each element can thus be accessed by its index, with the first index being zero. Normally, ObservableLists allow duplicate elements, as compared to Sets, where elements have to be unique.

Where ObservableList differs from the standard Java List is is in its extension of Java's Observable so that subscribed Observers are notified of any changes to its structure, or to its Observable elements' properties.

Author:
Cameron Behar
See Also:
List}, {@link Observable}

Method Detail

add

public void add(int location,
                T object)
Inserts the specified object into this ObservableList at the specified location. The object is inserted before the current element at the specified location. If the location is equal to the size of this ObservableList, the object is added at the end. If the location is smaller than the size of this ObservableList, then all elements beyond the specified location are moved by one position towards the end of the ObservableList.

Specified by:
add in interface java.util.List<T>
Parameters:
location - the index at which to insert
object - the object to add
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if adding to this ObservableList is not supported
java.lang.ClassCastException - if the class of the object is inappropriate for this ObservableList
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the object cannot be added to this ObservableList
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if location < 0 || location > size()

subList

public java.util.List<T> subList(int start,
                                 int end)
Returns an ObservableList of the specified portion of this ObservableList from the given start index to the end index minus one. The returned ObservableList is backed by this ObservableList so changes to it are reflected by the other.

Specified by:
subList in interface java.util.List<T>
Parameters:
start - the index at which to start the sublist
end - the index one past the end of the sublist
Returns:
a list of a portion of this ObservableList
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if start < 0, start > end or end > size()

suspendNotifications

public boolean suspendNotifications(boolean suspend)
Temporarily suspends the notification all of property changes to subscribed Observers. Most often this method is called when performing a large number of batch operations on an ObservableList, so that subscribers are not overloaded with a multitude of notifications.

Parameters:
suspend - a boolean indicating whether to suspend or reenable notifications to subscribed Observers
Returns:
true if notifications were previously suspended, false otherwise
See Also:
Observable}, {@link Observer}, {@link ObservableList}

toArray

public java.lang.Object[] toArray()
Returns an array containing all elements contained in this ObservableList.

Specified by:
toArray in interface java.util.Collection<T>
Specified by:
toArray in interface java.util.List<T>
Returns:
an array of the elements from this ObservableList

toArray

public <T> T[] toArray(T[] array)
Returns an array containing all elements contained in this ObservableList. If the specified array is large enough to hold the elements, the specified array is used, otherwise an array of the same type is created. If the specified array is used and is larger than this ObservableList, the array element following the collection elements is set to null.

Specified by:
toArray in interface java.util.Collection<T>
Specified by:
toArray in interface java.util.List<T>
Parameters:
array - the array
Returns:
an array of the elements from this ObservableList
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayStoreException - if the type of an element in this ObservableList cannot be stored in the type of the specified array
